message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this product, which I know will be incredibly valuable for you. I'm asking for $14,000 for it. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12,000. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to make sure it's a good deal for me.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I'm willing to work with you.  However, $12,000 is a bit too low for me. I'm happy to come down to $13,000. This is a fair price that still allows me to get a good return on my investment. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to come down to $13,000, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $12,750 for the product. I'm confident that's a fair price considering the value it will bring to me.

Bob, I appreciate your offer and your understanding of the product's value. I'm willing to come down a little further to $13,250. This reflects a compromise on both our sides, and allows us to reach a mutually beneficial agreement. Let me know your thoughts!
I appreciate your willingness to come down further, but I'm still trying to get as close to my budget as possible. I'm willing to meet you at $13,000, but no higher. Can we meet at $13,000?
